name: Sheraton Dallas Hotel by the Galleria

reviews.text: Clean, well situated hotel with efficient, friendly staff.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, erratic elevators.

reviews.text: Located at the intersection of 2 freeways. The fitness center is quite poky, but the equipment was very good, and perhaps the sizing is right, because I hardly ever saw anyone in there.
reviews.title: Great staff but below Sheraton's usual standards

reviews.text: The elevators were just crazy though. The hotel has 15 floors, and you cannot get to your floor without a room key.
reviews.title: Misses the details

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Furthermore, your floor is the only floor that your room key will take you to when going up, but not when going down. So, with a room on the 15th floor, if you wanted to visit a friend on the 4th, you would need to go to the 15th floor, and then go down to the 4th. On top of that, the room keys themselves were prone to random deactivation. And, when in the elevator with more than one person, the elevator was wont to ignore multiple floor requests, and only stop at the first button pressed. I had issues with this every single day of my stay. One evening, it took me 10 minutes to get from the lobby to my hotel room, due to room key and elevator issues. This is the kind of thing that should really be easy for hotel guests. I stay over 100 nights a year in hotels, so I am not exactly a greenhorn either.
reviews.title: Got it for $35 on Priceline and loved it!

reviews.text: Also, the bar shut too early.
reviews.title: Ups and Downs at the Sheraton

reviews.text: This hotel has the potential to be a very nice hotel but seems to have stopped trying. The hot tub was out, the pool area is very stark and would benefit from some plants, the women's restroom at the pool area was out of order, ice machine on our floor was broke...Room was nice enough except for the ancient pepperoni we found on the floor by the drapes. None of these things would matter alone, but all together show a lack of attention to detail and customer care.
reviews.title: Needs some work

likes.liked: — How close it was to the Galleria

reviews.text: The worst was the driver who took us to the Galleria Mall in the hotel shuttle. He crammed more people in the van than there was seat belts for. He did not wear a seatbelt. He had the radio set to an offensive rap station full of explicit sexual language. And when I asked him how he was he replied in an annoyed tone "Bored".
reviews.title: Club floor GREAT!

likes.disliked: — HVAC system was hard to regulate.

reviews.title: Average business-class.
reviews.text: The best was the rest of the hotel staff who were very friendly and helpful.
Would I stay here again? Not for the money.
reviews.title: Very nice and comfortable hotel.

likes.liked: — The shuttle that was offered for the surrounding area.
likes.disliked: — Only 2 computers in the business center....usually full.

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a conference, and were on the Club floor. Beautiful, spacious rooms with great views. Recently renovated, and it looks it. I did see the hallway on a lower floor, and it wasn't as regal. Our floor and room were great, as was the suite used for our meetings. (The bartender was very unfriendly, be warned.)
reviews.title: Better than I expected

reviews.text: We booked through Travelocity and the room was not right when we arrived. There was four of us and one king bed. They brought a roll away in and was going to charge me for it but I had my copy of the reservation that I had booked so then they gave the roll away for free. Good tching I had that with me! We picked this hotel because it is close to the Westin Galleria. There is alot of freeway noise all the time. There was alot of partying, yelling, doors slamming all night long, both nights. I will not stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Very noisy & loud

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night after reviewing quite a few hotels in this area of Dallas. Our experience was quite positive. Helpful friendly staff at the reception desk. Our room was large, with a very comfortable bed and very clean. It is clear that rennovation money was spent on the rooms (rather than halls and elevator) but since the room is where we spent the most time - this worked for us. AAA rate was quite reasonable.
reviews.title: Decent for the price

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel with some colleagues for a business trip. I booked three single rooms with king sized beds, when I got to my room, there were two beds. But when I went downstairs to complain, the man at the front desk said since I booked through Expedia, they don't guarantee rooms.
reviews.title: Okay service, dirty rooms, internet hackers in the business cetner

likes.disliked: — Rude staff, dirty rooms, unsecure business center

reviews.text: The room was okay, I was somewhat annoyed because there was what looked to be a food stain on the duster of the bed. A little gross.
reviews.title: Hotel Staff Let In A Burglar to My Room!
Nice Hotel
reviews.text: The breakfast was okay, the table dirty and the service was slow.

In the interest of full disclosure, I must tell that we paid $40 per night for 2 week-end nights, so I was not expecting too much, even though Priceline shows the hotel at 3 1/2*. The parking lot seemed to confirm my belief as it is a vast asphalt wasteland with signs posted on every vertical surface reminding you to lock your car and hide your valuables. Upon entering the huge lobby my opinion was altered. It is all marble and gleaming and much nicer than what the outside of the hotel would warrant.
reviews.title: Booked through BetterBidding and Priceline

reviews.text: We had requested and were assigned to a room with a king sized bed, room 1017, facing the downtown skyline. You are required to insert your room key into a slot in the elevator in order for the elevator to go to your floor. This seems to be a secure system, but was inconvenient for visiting friends on the 7th floor as the key ONLY allows access to the floor your room is on. The room and everything inside looked and smelled brand new. The paint had not a single mark on it. Even the towels and linens appeared new. The room was spacious and had the following amenities: Dataport, wifi, flat screen LCD TV, coffee pot with Starbucks coffee and Tazo Tea, hairdryer, alarm clock/radio, ironing board and iron. The a/c was ice cold and that is no small consideration in Texas in the summer. The mattress was very comfortable and the pillows were of good quality.
reviews.title: Nice place for the price

reviews.text: The bathroom is well appointed, with Bliss soaps, shampoos, etc...,but on the small side. Bathtub is of regular size. There is a heat lamp that does not heat much.
reviews.title: Indifferent staff

reviews.text: By far the best "amenity" at the hotel is the FREE shuttle. It goes to the Galleria and to much of Addison. Very handy to be dropped off at the front of the mall instead of having to navigate the huge parking garages there.
reviews.title: Good central location

reviews.text: The only small complaint is the icemaker on our floor was not working and the pool area jacuzzi was closed.
reviews.title: Surprised by just how helpful the staff were

description: The Sheraton Dallas North Hotel near the Galleria is a 14-floor high rise hotel surrounded by more than 200 Fortune 500 companies in the heart of the North Dallas business corridor.
